page.title: 03Wild Life
page.content: Two rivers cross the area - the Piddle and its tributary, Bere Stream. They join here and flow on past Hyde House and Wareham into Poole Harbour. They are chalk streams, fed by springs, and the clear water supports water crowfoot, watercress, trout and salmon. There is an artificial fish pond by the Piddle, where fishing is private. A stretch of Bere Stream near Bere Heath Farm is used for research by the Freshwater Biological Association Laboratory and is a site of Special Scientfic Interest. Kingfishers, common toads, bogbean and marsh orchids are found by the rivers, and grass snakes and badgers live nearby. Some ll0 acres of heathland are leased to the Dorset Naturalists Trust by A.R.C. as a Reserve, which conserves the habitats of smooth snakes, toads, adders, amongst others.
